div.head: Translated parts

p.seg: Now, foolish as I am I have received your writings
this is the texts and recipes you have edited,
have returned to a quiet place
analysed and considered their essential meaning
doubt my understanding
and would beg to raise a question." "Speak up." Punctuation must be ...yi shi. " "Yan zhi."
Now, regarding the recipes you have edited
those that heal in ten out of ten cases
When it's nine out of ten,
they let earth's spirits do the healing.
let heaven's spirits do the healing.
Recipes that heal in eight of ten cases
let human dynamic spirits do the healing [this use of jingshen is frequent in the TPJ].
Recipes with less success
must not be put to use.
Foolish as I am this is what I think: only because they install fear by suppression and control
can they heal.
Without such suppression and control
they cannot heal."
"Excellent,
what you have said!
You have understood the problem.
Well, as we all know the outside and inside of the whole that has no limit,
as seen by eyes and
heard by ears
and the species that move about
were all brought forth by heaven.
Had it not done so
nothing would be as it is.
Since each has its own spirit-like chieftain
everyone's life depends on someone,
The six farmyard animals for instance
depend on humans.
[Their] death and life lie only with humans.
So humans are the farmyard animals' Controller of Destiny.
These twelve thousand things develop all under the directorship of heaven and earth.
Should one thing not be in it
heaven's directorship would in part not suffice.
So heaven would return the thing under its rule,
and thus place it again in an honoured or lowly position under a chieftain [ Yang Jilin p. 1296: let it have a rank and a chieftain "enter a hierarchical relation and get to have a superior"CH]
Therefore, by means of heaven's Dao you can reign and regulate all.
By finding what is feared {"When they get something to be in fearful awe of CH}
you will heal all.
In this way, one's life {their lives CH} depends on heaven.
You know, Perfected, don't you?
Yes, we do.
All right,
You know.
I beg to ask a question
that is really pretentious.
Were it better I did not?
Go ahead. Don't be shy.
Nowadays, should a bandit assault people
he would bring everyone under his rule.
How can we think of him as being a chieftain under heaven's command?
Good,
your question!
Now a bandit who assaults people
simply has no justification.
He is preposterous in bringing people under his rule without any legitimacy
and will not be able to do it for long.
Each [such] act of bringing people under one's rule
is a heavy crime.
The county head will chase it up without end.
How can you say that [such a bandit] acts under heaven's command?
Now, were a king to bring people under his rule
where would be the need for prosecution?
The common people conduct their life relying on the king as chieftain
who issues commands.
Is this well understood, Perfected?
Now it is.
Excellent!
Concentrate on your studies
without reckless questions.
Heaven may find fault with people.
"Yes,
I have made a severe mistake. " [ bu ye belongs to the Master's response]
No, just be careful.
Don't take an interest in using shrewd expressions as would vulgar people.
Yes.
Now, foolish as I am I make grave mistakes whenever I say something.
At the same time, when I don't speak
I have no chance to gain knowledge.
Now I would again like to be permitted to raise a question.
I do not dare stop talking.
Go ahead.
Now, do only the myriad things each have a chieftain
or do heaven and earth also have one?
Oh!
What a deeply mysterious and far-reaching problem you have raised!
Now I know myself the question is pretentious.
Should I not use this chance to ask you
I would not gain knowledge.
Well, heaven has the highest pole star as chieftain
earth of the Kunlun,
the sun its being in the south,
the moon the full moon,
the stars the brightest star in the purple palace in the north,
the mountains the five eminent peaks,
the five eminent peaks Mount Tai, situated under the Pole Star,
the hundred rivers the big streams and the ocean,
those with shells the divine turtle,
those with scales the dragon,
those that fly with wings the male and female phoenix,
animals with fur the unicorn,
naked reptiles the human being,
and humans the sovereign.
There are more such cases in all under heaven
than can be reported.
I just give you the outline, Perfected,
to let you see how it begins.
Have you understood?
Yes, we have.
You must for yourself deeply think about what it means.
Indeed, it cannot all be reported.
The difficulty lies in deciding how to put it to use.
Yes.
Now, there is the old saying that what moves on feet has intelligence,
and should there be medicine in its body
not to wait until it is fully grown up
would be an untimely murder. [Hexagram 25: wuwang)
Why?
Mainly because there is a good chance that it would make the animal's ruler angry.
Now, once heaven's breath of great peace has arrived
it will have to reign jointly with the virtuous lord.
Were there untimely acts of violence
they would confuse the breath of great peace
and leave the government bewildered.
Now, how can small animals have an impact on heaven
and confuse and bewilder its government?
Oh,
you are still foolish and ignorant.
There has not yet been a breakthrough.
Now, each of these has its ruler.
This is just like the lowly and insignificant people in outlying regions in all directions
and the supreme sovereign's lowest subjects who are trivial and despicable
are not of the same sort.
Should some without cause get together to attack dozens of people
these people's family would turn resentful
and send a memorial to the sovereign.
On hearing what they say the sovereign would become very angry
and send someone down to conduct a formal investigation.
In confusion, provinces, districts and counties would make it into a big event.
So, those condemned to capital punishment
would not be just one person.
You know, don't you?
How alarming!
How alarming!
All right,
Since you know what is alarming
you shall definitely live long.
Yes.
Therefore, since the wise kings of old knew that the precedents set in heaven's law were obvious
they did not dare to use the penal code in a haphazard manner.
Instead, their thoughts were exceedingly deep and their considerations exceedingly far-reaching.
So, their reign was always in balance.
Without an physical effort
they matched heaven's feelings
which for them was of great importance.
Nowadays, previous kings are gradually forgotten.
After inheriting and transmitting [the load of trespasses]
everyone makes gains and suffers losses.
So, the government is hard to keep in balance.
You know, don't you?
Yes, we do.
At present, after the breath of great peace has arrived,
heaven cherishes the lord with virtue
and for this reason prepares to distribute warnings
and criticise those who oppose these warnings.
Hand my text to a lord of superior virtue.
He will on his own consider which intentions may not be good.
Yes.

div.seg: What are the crimes that all regular people commit?
A regular person does nothing wrong.
What crimes should he commit?
Step forward, Perfected.
Oh,
How can you be so dumb!
Foolish as I am I have not even started to comprehend.
Never in my life have I heard
that someone has committed a crime who has done nothing wrong and not broken the law.
If this is what you are saying
you state what is commonly said.
You do not realise that people in general commit, in fact, six big crimes
that are unforgivable.
They are put on trial in person
or have their progeny involved.
You, Perfected, have studied
but are not aware of these obvious crimes.
Although you have studied you are not enraged by [the people's] distraction?"
"Foolish as I am I don't care.
"You may not care,
but we all know that when common people die they are afflicted by resentment.
They truly come to their end from being without understanding.
What the situation is they realise only the moment they die.
Since the division between heaven and earth
the people in general have been blind until someone has enlightened them.
I would like to hear what it was.
Well,
To accumulate teachings without end
but refuse to instruct others on how to dissolve such blindness and search for life
is an unforgivable crime.
The culprit is tried in person
or has his progeny dragged in.
This is so
because he destructs what heaven has taught
and heaven is resentful.
To amass virtue without end
but refuse to instruct others on how to pay attention to preserving virtue
and nourishing one's disposition
is an unforgivable crime.
The culprit is tried in person
or has his progeny dragged in.
I am not enraged."
This is so
because he destroys the virtue that earth has nourished
and earth is resentful.
He is severely condemned.
Another person may pile up goods, millions and millions
but refuse to save people who are desperate and rescue those in need.
To let others die from hunger and cold
is and unforgivable crime.
The culprit is tried in person
or has his progeny dragged in.
This is so
because the products of the harmony [between Yin and Yang]
are the means by which heaven and earth show humaneness
and provide sufficient support for all
so that people do not become desperate.
But someone may interrupt this process by collecting [these products]
so that they cannot be spread.
This person is an enemy to the harmonious vapour (qi) of heaven and earth.
He is tried in person
or has his progeny dragged in.
(當 for 會) One must not for long [retain] what one has been collecting
but pass it on.
When heaven brings people to life
it lets them know
how to love what is good and detest what is evil.
Someone fortunate enough to have knowledge
will know of the teachings that origin in heaven but may think them worthless
and refuse to resolutely study how to save himself.
He will perhaps live long
in the body that heaven's dispensation and the ancestors have bestowed on him
but will think lightly of himself
and refrain from study. He will view death
in a careless manner. When close to death
he will turn resentful.
[This is] an unforgivable crime.
He is put on trial in person
or has his progeny dragged in.
He makes people live without understanding
and be resented by heaven.
Since this is so,
[人for天 ] when people resolutely enact Dao
there is constant good luck
while there is misfortune and death when Dao is ignored.
Although heaven is fond of human beings, wants them to be good
and has made Dao appear in the human body
someone may refuse to implement Dao with energy.
We call him person without Dao.
Without bias heaven lets people make Dao their own and live long.
But to cut heaven's Dao off
is to be resented be heaven.
That someone knows from birth to be virtuous and good
but refuses to properly learn how to practice virtue
sees no worth in it, detests rearing things
and does wrong by making light of his person
is an unforgivable crime.
He is put on trial in person
or has his progeny dragged in.
Since this is so
earth objects to him.
It likes people to nourish by virtue.
Someone as just described does not care about things,
does not like virtue
and is not fond of the body that he has inherited from his ancestors.
Earth condemns him.
When heaven brings people to life
it, fortunately, gives them enough personal energy
so that they can dress and feed themselves.
But someone may refuse to invest his energy
and will instead starve and freeze.
In neglect of the body [that he has received] from his ancestors
he light-heartedly puts his energy to rest -
energy by means of which he could get clothes and food.
Instead to continues to talk of himself as someone who is so wretched as to be on the brink of starvation and freezing to death.
On the other hand, he always looks up with respect to houses that have a lot of wealth
and exists in reliance on them.
This crime is unforgivable.
He is put on trial in person
or has his progeny dragged in.
Since this is so
of the goods that heaven and earth have produced in order to nourish human beings
everyone must according to their ability take hold of.
Someone who has obtained enough will not suffer from exhaustion.
But if he puts his energy at rest instead of activating it he makes light of himself.
Perhaps someone has desires that bring him into conflict with others.
Everyone who takes what belongs to others by force
is an enemy to the central harmony [that exists between heaven and earth].
It is obvious that this crime deserves death.
These six crimes are despised and hated by heaven.
They are unforgivable.
You know, Perfected, don't you?
Yes, we do.
We would like to hear from the Celestial Master
why these crimes are so serious?
Oh, no!
Why is it that from day to day you are more foolish?
These crimes exterminate families.
What reason could there be to discuss their seriousness?
Foolish as we are, we are completely naive
and do not understand the main point.
If the Celestial Master would only point it out to us, again,
and let us understand the main point.
Once we thoroughly understand what it means
we would not dare commit another offence.
Well,
Perfected, you have put this well.
What I have said should be listened to.
You, Perfected, must in person take care to record it.
Yes, we will.
All right.
Now majestic heaven with its Dao
brings everything to life.
All the different things
look up to heaven for their mandate.
Now someone with Dao and of great intelligence (for the term rou see TPJ sections 103, 105, 107, 108 and 110: positive quality in someone in official employment, or someone employable.)
may perhaps remain silent in his deep knowledge of Dao
and let it appear in his belly
while refusing to teach it to others.
But to teach Dao
is like giving people fire.
Should few people come to fetch it
no damage would be done to its source.
Should more people come than can be counted
there would also be no damage to its source .
Now a person who is so fortunate as to be able to share something
by teaching the people who live under heaven
assists heaven in bringing things to life,
assists earth in rearing what has taken shape
and assists the sovereign in bringing about good adjustment.
He also lets everyone hold onto Dao,
search for life and hate death,
encourages self-regulation [for zhi as aspect of meditation practice see TPJChao p. 12-13; cf. Yang TPJ 2016: 839] and assists the government.
The people will not again break the law
and cause awful misfortune.
Since his attitude is good
he assists heaven, earth and the sovereign in nourishing all twelve thousand things
so that each enjoys a long life.
Once the people hold on to a humane attitude
they will not again think lightly of robbing and damaging the myriad things.
Heaven will then for this reason be merry,
earth will be quite pleased
and the sovereign will in great joy be free from worries.
Such a person would have achieved a lot of merit, or don't you think so?
Now, if in this way one person instructs a hundred ignorant people
and a hundred, doing likewise,
instruct ten thousand,
ten thousand will together
educate a million.
When a million become teachers
the people who gain instruction will be without limit.
There is so much good in this
that it merges up above with heaven's wishes
and matches down below more things than can be counted.
Everywhere, the people enjoy life and do good deeds.
The sovereign, freed from government tasks goes on spiritual excursions.
Again, why would anyone hurt others
by depriving them from instruction?
Nowadays some are so fortunate as to have received instructions and warnings from former teachers
and to fully embrace perfect teachings (zhi dao) but cut them off.
They do not show them [to others]
and let the people remain without a mandate they can rely on. [gui ming a buddh. term?]
This makes them die violently and full of resentment.
We speak of a disruption to the Dao of heaven.
heaven is no longer able to bring to life
and earth no longer able to nourish.
(大 for 夫) A person of some standing is unable not to know of Dao. (The TPJ has fu ren only at the beginning of sentences where fu can always be understood as particle)
When human beings in multiple ways forget Dao and act recklessly
Small-minded people are without Dao, often think lightly of themselves
and proceed in a contrarious manner.
They act against heaven's patterns and the structures of earth.
They rise up to become bandits and robbers, rob and injure others
and break the king's laws.
They cause the lord much trouble.
They have such wide-ranging connections that they cannot be defeated.
The lord thinks of them day and night.
Entranched in his wretchedness
he makes heaven and earth lose their alignment.
Disasters, anomalies and irregularities do not end
and make the sovereign maintain and pass on [the trespasses of former generations].
And yet, I have not been able to tell all.
To interrupt heaven's Dao
is a crime of such great contrariness
that it cannot be reported in full.
Therefore, I have just started with the quintessence
that the crime is severe enough to deserve death?
and explained it to you, Perfected. It is obvious, isn't it,
However, when dying someone may still have too many misdeeds that are not atoned for
and for this reason has his progeny dragged in. “
"How frightening!"
"You would better pay attention to these matters, Perfected.
However, since you know of at least one aspect that is frightening
we may say that you have obtained long lasting good luck
and will stay away from misfortune and harm. "
"Yes,
we would not dare move away from these instructions."
"Well,
you are already worthy and enlightened.
Since you know heaven's mandate
you are bound to live and avoid death,
there is no doubt. "
"Now that we have with great respect heard the mandate of heaven's teachings
we would like to know the instructions on the virtue of earth."
"Well,
it is so that the great virtue of earth
lies mainly in that it obeys heaven's Dao
by well nourishing the myriad things.
Of the many different sorts of things
none does not receive bountiful virtue.
Earth is someone who brings to fruition what is within it.
Therefore, a person of great intelligence and virtue
must act as does earth.
Since he is so fortunate to have received merit and energy from former teachers,
he is able to store good Dao and unlimited virtue.
It is always the case that when someone with virtue teaches others
it is like bringing them close to a great water and letting them drink from it.
When few people come to learn virtue
they do not damage its root.
When more people come than can be counted
they also do no damage to the root.
教勑for 教教 ( Yu TPJ 2001: 206) If they are instructed with great energy
they will, all of them, know how to remain intelligent and hold onto virtue.
Everyone will, looking after himself, rear his person.
Those good at it support heaven up above in nourishing the things that grow
and support earth down below in feeding things until they are ripe.
They all combine their energy in solidarity
free from any evil intention.
Among them someone of great worth and bright insight who is easy to inform
can transform himself and rise
to become a lord's assistant.
Someone of average worth can become a chief clerk or teacher.
Someone who lacks understanding
can still become a leader among the people.
Among the people in general, nobody would not want to become virtuous and do good.
To instruct like this
is of benefit ror heaven up above
and for earth down below.
It is the root of a great transformation.
It helps the sovereign to nourish the population
and prevents them from oppositional and evil conduct,
while the lord, free from worries, allows his sleeves to hang down.
It is obvious that [someone who instructs] has great merit.
Heaven and earth love him
and he can move into office.
Now someone may perhaps hold onto much virtue (則 meaning what??)
(delete the comma after 閉) but pretend to be a fool and cut off the road to Dao and virtue.
He does not assist heaven in nourishing what is about to come to life
assist earth in nourishing what is about to ripen
or assist the sovereign in keeping the people in harmony.
(令for 今) In consequence, the descendents of a foolish person
are dumb without any understanding.
For them, white and black are indistinguishable.
(至 for 互, Yu 2001: 207) They will not change until they die
but remain small-minded people
who cannot separate east from west,( Yang 844: dong is road to life, xi road to death; Yu 207, more plausibly: they achieve nothing)
take no care of their person and think lightly of themselves.
They follow each other in doing wrong
so that mischievous devices are piled up. (Yu 2001: 207 understands guei 軌 as jiu究 “plan, device")
People situated up above and down below cannot teach each other.
Being stupid and distracted
they refrain from holding interdictions in awe.
Above they act against the patterns of heaven
down below against the structures of earth.
Their movements oppose the four seasons
and give disorder to the five phases.
For the lord they are a great worry
and people of low standing are injured
by their robberies. (delete comma)
Some even destroy themselves.
They treat father and mother with contempt
and have therefore no progeny.
However, I now explain to you, Perfected, the quintessence
to let you see where it [all] starts
so that everyone will with complete insight only put things as he sees them.
The refusal to teach how to retain virtue
we call cutting off earth's way of nourishing.
This is the crime.
It cannot be put into words. But on his death
there are still crimes that are not atoned for
so that his progeny is dragged in.
You know Perfected, don't you?"
“How very frightening!"
"Since you understand that this is a cause for fear
we may say that you are able to live on.
You must only take care."
"Yes, we will.
With great respect we have received prohibitions in regard to Dao and virtue.
We would like to hear about the conduct of a person who is humane."
"Well,
as is well known all the goods that heaven and earth have brought forth
are already entrusted to human beings.
So goods are without root.
They are neither up above fixed to heaven
nor down below to earth.
Goods
belong to the central harmony [between heaven and earth]
which allows them to be moved about.
They go and they come as if they were floating.
The person responsible must make sure to rescue the desperate and relieve those in need.
Now people amass gold, silver and precious objects.
Houses of much wealth
have more than billions of [measures] of grain
that they have collected and allow to rot.
If a worthy man knows how to distribute goods poor houses
are full of joy. He deserves to be called humane.
He assists earth in nourishing things
and assists the sovereign in maintaining honest and respectful people.
But a house that has billions
can rescue ten thousand families.
When such a house gives away what is old and takes in what is new
in an attitude that does not consider harm or profit
their virtue matches heaven and earth.
They are heard of in far-away places.
Moreover, this allows them to always get new things
and discard what is rotten.
Those worthies among them who are of high rank
regularly present the [list of their] merits to the sovereign.
Those of small rank
have their name regularly raised for advancement in the district or village.
Among the people those who are so very foolish as to not appreciate the mercy they have received
are not more than two or three out of ten.
How should this make the person who gives so very poor? (transl. Yang 2016: 847); BH How should it be possible to let another person be in great poverty?
Once a person does good without end
worthy men of high rank who are intelligent and well-informed will raise him
He will be famous within the country
and within the four seas, people who take him as a teacher will block the roads.
Should an enlightened king or wise leader hear of him
and gain his assistance in nourishing the population he would be quite pleased.
He would therefore request his presence at court
and set him up in the rank of the three excellencies.
On this basis he would gain honours
that for generations would remain in place.
However, people of great humaneness
are rare in the world.
A person who pays proper attention to his ancestors
while not putting a load on his sons and grandsons
is someone whom heaven and earth love.
The hundred spirits favour him
(朋 for 明) and the sovereign treats him a friend.
Neighbours point to him as to a parent,
his merits are registered in heaven and on earth
and do not go away.
The emolument that is attached to his official position
is never lowered.
His name is known among the ten thousand people,
invariably.
So why would someone not be humane?
He may at times come by a fertile piece of land ,
fully obtain the goods of the realms between heaven and earth
and hoard billions of measures of corn,
millions of precious objects and things in gold and silver.
But he stores them securely and hides them away in a dark chamber
so that they all rot.
When he meets someone in desperate circumstances who comes to demand help
he berates this person and gives nothing.
What he gives he does not give up
but certainly seeks to take back with interest.
At times this is twice the amount,
at other times it ends only with four to five times [of the original amount].
When you give to the rich
and take from the poor
you let them die of hunger and cold.
This is to ignore principles
and laugh at them instead.
It is resented by heaven,
condemned by earth
seen as hostile by human beings
and abhorred by the hundred spirits.
This is so
because these goods belong to heaven, earth and the realms between them
who jointly let human beings feed on them.
But this house that by accident laid hold of the place where these goods are gathered
is like the rats in a granary
that usually are the only ones to eat their fill
although the millet in such a large granary
is originally not meant to be only the possession of rats.
(小 for 少) The treasures of the imperial house
are not originally meant to belong to only one person.
People who do not have enough
must all take from it.
Foolish people without understanding
are of the opinion that they are always the only ones entitled to own something.
(户 for 尸)They do not understand that from the goods that the ten thousand households have delivered
everyone must obtain clothes and food.
Keen on his possessions and capricious regarding [people's] anger or happiness
someone may refuse to put energy into rescuing the desperate and relieving the needy.
He brings ten thousand families to their end:
In spring they are without seeds
and in autumn without harvests.
Stricken by resentment they shout to heaven.
Heaven is touched
and earth moved.
Someone who does not assist the ruler in rescuing the desperate and relieving the needy
is the most inhumane person between heaven and earth.
When someone is approached [for a contribution] to the performance of a sacrifice
but does not give anything
the hundred spirits hate him
and wish to let him be without descendants.
In a district of village he is cursed
and people wish he would die.
When bandits hear of him
they come with raised weapons
to attack his premises.
In the end, family members may suffer or even die
but he stubbornly refuses to give anything away.
Instead, he buries it deep in the ground
to let no one else see it.
Without any excuse he cuts off the goods of all under heaven.
By diminishing above ground what could be of use
he creates instead a "great block" (34th hexagram) underneath.
Since heaven hates him a lot
and earth massively objects to him
he stands greatly condemned.
The goods that belong to the realms between heaven and earth are intercepted and become less and less.
So, to put this person on trial is not enough.
Many people die of hunger and cold.
He is a serious enemy of humankind.
We all know that heaven only likes [people with] Dao,
that earth only likes [people with] virtue
and that the realms between heaven and earth like [people with] humaneness.
Things in general should be situated under heaven and above earth
and then go everywhere to provide for people in general who do not have enough. (skip semicolon)
But when things are buried in the ground
they in great sadness hate that they cannot show themselves.
We all know that heaven as well as earth
basically do not like that [people] wish to obtain goods.
But what heaven likes is people who bring to life
and earth likes people who nourish things.
A small-minded person with no understanding
blocks the path for the goods of the realms between heaven and earth
so that people cannot make adequate provisions.
Such a person annihilates what heaven has brought to life
and robs what earth has nourished .
By hiding these goods in the ground without being entitled to do so
he makes the country poor
and shrinks its resources
so that in cannot guarantee the people's livelihood.
He makes the virtuous ruler's government
appear empty-handed.
Now, to produce goods and merchandise from gold, silver and other precious metals (comma between zhi and yong)
demands a lot of the people's labour power.
(苦 for 若)Such labour is truly hand and strenuous
and should be put to use for the country's sake.
When someone with excuse discards goods
(土 for 上) and moves them away into the soil
the earth does not enjoy receiving them
but sees them as a great illness
and a great block.
Now [this] foolish person is really inhumane.
Once he has committed such a crime
he must die, or what do you think?
Amongst such people, there may even be someone who is so careless to not know what is enough.
Full of resentment he may raise arguments
and turn to confiscate the goods of low-ranking families with small means.
In no way does he understand when to stop.
But I can see that you are eager.
I have just explained the essential point
to let you know how it starts.
The misdeeds that someone commits who is not humane are so many
that they cannot all be outlined
(雖 for 難) even if we do the best we can.
You must think about it, Perfected, deeply.
Therefore, someone whom the three vapours of heaven, earth and the central harmony between them detest
will when he dies have crimes not atoned for
that his progeny is bound to be dragged in.
Perfected, you'd better understand, wouldn't you?
Yes, indeed.
How frightening.
I do not wish to hear of it.
Should you, Perfected, ignore these words
heaven is bound to rob you of your life
in order to let you come to the understanding
that it objects to your continued existence.
Commit yourself to paying attention to what is going on.
Yes, we will.
Now we have already with great respect received warnings on Dao, virtue and humaneness.
We would like to hear and understand what it means to not enjoy the study of true Dao.
You have put this well.
